messages.message: Hey team, what does the 'open' button do on the home page? I'm not sure I've ever used it and it just seems to take me to a blank page instead of into Workspaces which is where I would expect (this seems to be to create a project rather than open)
@Weiming Wu I think you just fixed this for the upcoming release right?

Yea I just changed it last week
It's supposed to open Build with either the most recently opened project for that browser, or if that browser never opened a project, it opens one of the projects in that user's personal workspace. If there are no projects in that user's personal workspace, it shows that screen.
I donâ€™t think we covered this case in the latest navbar updates. @hannah @tj.serkes did we cover this in the new designs?

> If there are no projects in that user's personal workspace, it shows that screen.
I think the easy fix is to just direct to Workspaces in this case, as Hamish suggested?
I'll leave it to design to make that decision - it's kinda weird to make the "Open" button for opening Build to link to Workspaces, but I'm biased from seeing it behave a certain way for years now
i think most users expect "Open" to link to Workspaces - have we seen any indication of this in prior user testing? @alagu

Hey! we're actually redesigning the home page (cc: @margaret.tomaszczuk and @alagu @charlie) and will be removing "open". The user will be able to either - create new or "view all" which will bring them to workspaces. Perhaps we can consider making this short term change to get rid of the open behavior?
Here is a preview of the designs - we could do something similar for this
(also designs subject to change - only in draft state!)
@Weiming Wu what do you think about the short term change to replace "Open" with a "View all" button that directs to "Workspaces"?
Yea that makes sense. Let me get something up real quick
